entries.meaning: A very large outdoor sign, generally used for advertising.
examples: All America was on the verge of spring and the countryside was coming to glory, what we could see of the countryside through the smoke and billboards.

entries.meaning: (dated) A flat surface, such as a panel or fence, on which bills are posted; a bulletin board.
examples: When a show leaves New York, it carries posters wherewith to embellish each fence and bill board in the land [...]

entries.meaning: (nautical) A piece of thick plank, armed with iron plates, and fixed on the bow or fore-channels of a vessel, for the bill or fluke of the anchor to rest on.
(computer graphics) A sprite that always faces the screen, no matter which direction it is looked at from.
